intro: Minuartia moehringioides, commonly known as the rock spurge, is a small, mat-forming flowering plant belonging to the family Caryophyllaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of South America, particularly in Argentina and Chile. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to harsh, arid environments. Its flowers are small, usually white or pink, and appear in clusters during the spring or early summer. Minuartia moehringioides is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats, where it thrives in full sun and well-drained conditions.
